meta.description: Lufthansa Senator Lounge (Schengen) at Frankfurt Airport (FRA), Terminal 1, Concourse A. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Lufthansa Senator Lounge (Schengen)

location.terminalDirections: Level 2, opposite the Duty Free Shop, towards Gate A50.

lounge.description: Relax at the Lufthansa Senator Lounge prior to your Schengen departure from Frankfurt. Enjoy a comfortable, peaceful, and modern environment away from the terminal's hustle and bustle. Imbibe at the well-stocked self-serve bar and enjoy a delectable, nourishing meal from the buffet selection (currently unavailable). Upgrade your pre-flight experience now.

general: Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.
warning: This location does not accept passengers in airline uniforms.
For passengers departing from a different concourse or terminal, this lounge is located approximately 10 minutes from your gate area via Skyline Train plus additional security check time.

reviews.content: Like it a lot. Was nice to catch your breath between the legs.
The lounge itself is big, but not enough counting that it is the only Senator lounge non Schengen, the wines and spirits very good, food it could do better but OK. Worth going but can improve.
Good lounge but almost always overcrowded.
Very nice, moderately crowded at 14:00 on a weekday.
The lounge itself is decent, but almost always when I visit it is hopelessly overcrowded. People standing around looking for places to sit down. Bad management from LH.
Only spent approximately 15 minutes here in transit. The food was OK but nothing special. Fine for its purpose which is a stop on the way to your next gate!
One of the beer taps was out, and not enough stalls in the restroom. Food spread was so-so.
Pleasant comfortable lounge with reasonable buffet selection. Nominally first class but really a *Alliance Gold lounge, so like a very good business lounge. Wraps made on request fresh.

You'd think with a 2.5 hour stop over after 22 hours flying you would be able to get a shower.. but no, think again - this lounge has a severe lack of showers and after 2 hrs on waiting list I left...
Good option for Star Alliance Gold members. Food selection is a bit underwhelming (beer is good though) but lots of seating variety and space is a plus.
It is spacious and comfy. It doesn't lack for alcohol or caffeine, but food selection is just okay.
Nice oasis in the middle of busy Frankfurt airport. Nice array of snacks, free WiFi and free alcohol. Access for Star Alliance Gold.
Decent array of food and drinks. In contrast to reception staff, ladies taking care off bathroom facilities are not service-minded at all. No greetings, no smiling, no eye contact etc.
Worth the visit but more crowded than a Senator lounge should be.
Lots of space, but still crowded early in the morning. Nice showers and resting area. Food was average, OK selection of beverages. Helpful staff.
Large lounge, staff keeps it tidy even when it's crowded. Heated floors in the shower was a nice surprise. The Internet is working well even with a lot of people here right now.
Probably one of the best lounges in FRA.
With FRA being such a busy airport, it can be crowded in the lounge at peak hours. The showers are good but early mornings the wait can be too long. Eg 1h this morning. They have Nutella ðŸ˜Š
Huge lounge, well stocked on F&B, including hot meals. Very busy, and can get crowded. Wifi is topnotch - speed and reliable. A favorite.
Always hot. Not too busy, quiet, more than ample space. Decent F&B.
Very crowded but was kept clean. Good food. Comfy.

Been here every other month or so. Better than business lounges, but not as good as the other Senator lounge with open bar with bartender. Depends on timing, it can get very crowded, despite the size.
Yep, it's a very large lounge, my favorite at FRA now that Skylounge is closed. Large selection of seating types and food.
Great lounge but they only offered patato salad and wurst (and bread).
This is a huge lounge that offers nice, hot food, ample seats, and fast internet.
The Lufthansa staff was pretty unfriendly at this lounge.

location.terminalDirections: Next to Gate A13, Level 2, opposite the Duty Free Shop.
Near Gate A26, proceed one level up to the entrance.
Level 2, opposite the Duty Free Shop, next to Gate A13.
Located behind Airport Entrance 13 (Tor 13) when arriving by car.
After Passport Control, proceed towards Gates B24-B28 and take the lift or stairs to the lounge entrance.
After Passport Control, proceed towards Gates B44-B48 and take the lift or stairs to the lounge entrance.
Departure Area B, next to Gate B22.
Departure Area B, opposite Gate B42, next to Gate B43.
Outside of Passport Control and Security Checkpoint, Arrival Area B, immediately behind the Baggage Claim.
Landside, between Concourses B and C on the Gallery Level, next to the Travel Market (Reisemarkt).
After Passport Control but before final Security Checkpoint, Departure Area C, near Gates C14-C15.
After Passport Control but before final Security Checkpoint, Departure Area C, near Gate C14 and Gate C15.
Level 4, opposite the Duty Free Shop towards Gate Z50.
Level 3, opposite the Duty Free Shop towards Gate Z50.
